sen.e: A payer added two sho (unit of volume, approx. 1.8 liters) of nobemai (additional rice to cover the loss in weight of the land tax rice) to one bale (traditional unit for rice, which is 60 kilograms) three to (measure of volume, approx. 18 liters) and five sho (unit of volume, approx. 1.8 liters) of annual rice tax, and paid the total of three to and seven sho of rice tax.

sen.e: Previously, a payer heaped up masu (a measure) with rice and rendered it because the amount of nobemai (additional rice o cover the loss in weight of the land tax rice) was not set.

sen.j: しかし、元和 (日本)2年から1俵を3斗5升として、これに2升の延米を加えて、3斗7升入にして、御蔵に納めさせた（地方凡例録5）。
sen.e: But since 1616, a payer had to pay 3 to (measure of volume, approx. 18 liters) and 7 sho (unit of measure, approx. 1.8 liters) of rice tax to okura (a rice storehouse of the Edo shogunate) because one bale was set at three to (measure of volume, approx. 18 liters) and five sho (unit of measure, approx. 1.8 liters), and two sho of nobemai was added on (Jikata Hanreiroku 5).
